definitions.definition: a person who believes in and promotes the truth or benefits of an idea or theory.
examples: an early exponent of the teachings of Thomas Aquinas
synonyms: booster "the new premier is an exponent of free trade"

definitions.definition: a person who has and demonstrates a particular skill, especially to a high standard.
examples: he's the world's leading exponent of country rock guitar
synonyms: booster "the new premier is an exponent of free trade"

definitions.definition: a quantity representing the power to which a given number or expression is to be raised, usually expressed as a raised symbol beside the number or expression (e.g., 3 in 23 = 2 × 2 × 2).
a linguistic unit that realizes another, more abstract unit.
